dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5682 IH: To take certain land in the State of California into trust for the benefit of the Pechanga Band of Indians, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Issa introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To take certain land in the State of California into trust for the benefit of the Pechanga Band of Indians, and for other purposes.

section.header: Transfer of land into trust for the Pechanga Band of Indians

subsection.text: Subject to valid existing rights and the conditions described in subsection (d), the covered land is hereby taken into trust for the benefit of the Tribe.
The land taken into trust under subsection (a) shall be—

paragraph.text: part of the reservation of the Tribe; and
administered in accordance with the laws and regulations generally applicable to property held in trust by the United States for the benefit of an Indian Tribe.
At least 45 days before termination of the MOU entered into under subsection (b)(3), the Tribe shall submit notice of the termination to—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on Natural Resources of the House of Representatives;
the Committee on Indian Affairs of the Senate;
the Assistant Secretary for Indian Affairs; and
the members of Congress representing the area subject to the MOU.

paragraph.text: The Tribe shall report any termination or violation of the MOU to the parties identified in paragraph (1), unless the violation or termination is due to the disestablishment of the Santa Margarita Ecological Reserve.
The land taken into trust under subsection (a) shall be—

subparagraph.text: subject to all valid liens, rights-of-way, reciprocal road rights-of-way agreements, licenses, leases, permits, and easements existing on the date of the enactment of this Act;

clause.text: purposes consistent with the maintenance of the land as open space; and
the protection, preservation, and maintenance of the archaeological, cultural, and wildlife resources on the land.

paragraph.text: Nothing in this paragraph prohibits the construction or maintenance of utilities or structures that are—

subparagraph.text: consistent with the maintenance of the land taken into trust under subsection (a) as open space; and
constructed for the protection, preservation, and maintenance of the archaeological, cultural, and wildlife resources on the land.

paragraph.text: The land taken into trust under subsection (a) shall not be used for any class II gaming or class III gaming under the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act (as those terms are defined in section 4 of that Act (25 U.S.C. 2703)).

subsection.text: Nothing in this Act shall alter, or require the alteration of, any existing water rights or service agreements.
The Map shall be kept on file and available for public inspection in the appropriate offices of the Bureau of Land Management.

paragraph.text: The term covered land means all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to the approximately 1,261 acres of land in Riverside County, California, administered by the Bureau of Land Management and generally depicted as ___ on the Map.
The term Map means the map titled ___, and dated ___.
The term MOU means a memorandum of understanding that applies to the covered land.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior.
The term Tribe means the Pechanga Band of Indians.
